results.content: It's a good course but it's not a Windows-friendly tutorial at all. First section shows how to do a task with Windows and then not again after. I'll change my rating when/if I can complete.

response.content:
Hi Sarah, 
Thanks for the review, Windows is not user friendly environment if you really wish to enhance your development skill in python/django. 
1)I will recommend using a macbook or install ubuntu desktop in your pc(dual boot).
2)However, easiest way is to install vmware workstation player (https://my.vmware.com/en/web/vmware/free#desktop_end_user_computing/vmware_workstation_player/12_0) and install ubuntu on it. 
3)Go Cloud (C9.io) offers suitable platform to run django App. You may wish to create a account there and give a try. A free account give 1 private repository along with few public repositories. Here is a kickstart page of c9 (https://community.c9.io/t/setting-up-django/1727). Just remember, c9 is a controlled environment so you wont have freedom with everything like ports, etc
Any problem you face, while setting the environment you can ask in QA section. I will make sure to be prompt with my reply.
Regards,
Abhijan
response.content_html:
Hi Sarah,
Thanks for the review, Windows is not user friendly environment if you really wish to enhance your development skill in python/django.
1)I will recommend using a macbook or install ubuntu desktop in your pc(dual boot).
2)However, easiest way is to install vmware workstation player (https://my.vmware.com/en/web/vmware/free#desktop_end_user_computing/vmware_workstation_player/12_0) and install ubuntu on it.
3)Go Cloud (C9.io) offers suitable platform to run django App. You may wish to create a account there and give a try. A free account give 1 private repository along with few public repositories. Here is a kickstart page of c9 (https://community.c9.io/t/setting-up-django/1727). Just remember, c9 is a controlled environment so you wont have freedom with everything like ports, etc
Any problem you face, while setting the environment you can ask in QA section. I will make sure to be prompt with my reply.
Regards,
Abhijan
